message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with activity detection, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a new network architecture for activity detection, which involves learning activity proposal detectors and classifiers at different temporal scales. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and multimedia (cs.MM). Additionally, the paper uses contextual information to improve recognition, which is a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on two public benchmarks, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
